content.description: The hard part is getting from the ground to the second bolt, but no give away all the way to the anchor.
content.location: Goes up the Black Streak in the middle of the Manifest Destiny wall.  Frequently wet in the spring.

content.description:
The weasels have their revenge on this one. Brutal moves off the deck and a sustained finish make it the hardest route of the three 5.12's on the cool flowstone panel. Once you pay the steep entry fee you will be rewarded with awesome technical movement on in-cut pockets and grippy slopers all the way to the chains.

Start left hand on a terrible sidepull crimp and right hand in a shallow 3 finger pocket. Crank up and right to a grippy nub, and then high to a bad left hand slot. Make a technical traverse left on minuscule holds to the snake eye pockets, and then up left to a sinker mono. From here take slopers and small pockets up to the chains where the holds finally start to get bigger.

Would be 3 stars if it were longer and the bottom boulder problem wasn't so heinous.

EDIT: Sounds like people are starting on the route to the right and traversing in after the bottom boulder and is still 5.12c. If you do the direct it is probably harder, maybe 12d?
content.location: The red streak. (left most route on the Weasel Wall)

content.description: Start to the right of the Revolution is Evolution flake, moving up and right onto the face. Generous pocket pulling gets you to the anchors.

A long route (130ft) starting on a block left of some trees.  Crux is from bolts 2-4 with an interesting steep pocket pulling section above the first ledge and a strange mantel near the top.  Perhaps the longest easy sport route in the Sinks.
content.protection: About 16 clips, 2-3 single length runners useful.
content.location:
Walk west from Spooky Tooth until almost to a big corner.  Route is on the long slab right of the corner.

Route is 130ft long.  There is an anchor on top and another about 30ft down on the second ledge for rappelling with one 60m rope.

climbs.name: Spooky Tooth-Right Side
climbs.fa: Bob Branscomb, Kristi Stouffer, Bill Hunt 1990s

content.description: A trad climb with bolts. Jam and layback the right side of this big flake to the fifth bolt, where you layback up then left onto a little ledge (crux). Then up the pocketed face past a bolt (another crux) to the anchor. The flakes at the crux may seem a little rickety, but they are quite nicely locked on there.
content.protection: 7 clips + 2 for the SS ring anchors.
content.location: Walk west a few feet from Movable Feast to this big flake lying against the wall. Ascend the bolted right side.  The left side has been done with gear (same crew) and is 5.5.

climbs.name: Spooky Tooth-Finger Fangs
climbs.fa: Jan2021 Bob Branscomb, Kristi Stouffer, Mark Watkins

content.description: Start in the corner forming the left side of the Spooky Tooth flake.  Scramble up a bit, clip the first bolt.  Work up and step around onto the outside of the flake, rather balancy.  Small pockets and pinches lead through the crux from bolts 2 to 5.  Join the Right Side route at bolt 7 and proceed to the anchor shared with that route.
content.protection: 7 bolts + 2 clips for the anchor (ring anchor).  Well protected through the crux.
content.location: This route goes up the obvious bolt line on the outside of the Spooky Tooth.

content.description: Tricky prow climb.
content.location: Rounded prow to the right of "Manifest Destiny".

content.description:
Shares same start with Sugar Mountain (see description).  At the 3rd bolt, traverse right and then straight up.  Pocket pull the steep wall above the first ledge.  From anchor on second ledge, traverse up and right to a cool, steep, knobby finish to the anchor.  Crux around bolts 2-4 and pocket wall.

Shares consideration for longest easy sport route in Sinks with Sugar Mountain.
content.protection:
About 16 clips, 3-4 single length runners useful.

Anchor on top and another about 30ft down on ledge.
content.location:
Same start as Sugar Mountain (see description).

Can rappell route with 60m rope.

content.description: Tech undercling/flake system with some face holds also.  Most likely damaged (hardware and holds) from the last fire.
Inside corner accessed via a little flake ledge at base of climb.  Well protected.
Layback up the flake.  Crux is stepping up from the top of the flake.  Fun little route.
content.location: Left most route of Revolution/Take Some Petrol/Hand on the Torch group---see Fairfield West topo.  Start up a flake and then straight up to anchor.

climbs.name: Movable Feast
climbs.fa: Bob Branscomb, Ed DeLong, Kristi Stouffer 1999

content.description: Scramble up the pedestal at the base of the flake on the left side of the Manifest Destiny wall.  Fairly sustained liebacking up the flake to the anchor.  Spacey and cool and fun, if you like liebacks.  You could off-width it but, yecckk.
content.location: The flake on the left side of the wall where Manifest Destiny is located.

climbs.name: Manifest Destiny
climbs.fa: Ed DeLong, Norm Thompson, Bob Branscomb 1999

content.description: Fairly sustained pocket climbing throughout.  A very good route, unfortunately it is short. Positive pockets but you'll be good and pumped when you get to the anchor.
content.protection: Original bolts replaced 4/25/19 w/SS bolts+rings for anchor and glue-ins for protection bolts.
content.location: Walk west from Kashmir up to a short, red and gray streaked wall.  Manifest Destiny is the route farthest right on this wall, before the corner.

content.description: Climb flake/crack to rest below bulge then over bulge to face above.
content.location: Right of Revolution is Evolution area on buttress left of low angle rock. Between Hi Ho Silver and Sugar Mountain

content.description: Fun route with the hardest part in the upper third, a lower angle 5.7 small hold/smearing face on nice rock (push/pull and wind around a bit).  Easy and fun pocket pulling to there.  Well protected.
content.location: Walk west from Sugar Mountain about 50 feet.  A narrow grassy path above a block goes up to some trees at the base of a prominent long lower angle face with two black streaks running down it.  Boulder up a pedestal to the first bolt, straight up from there.  A full 100 ft to anchor on a nice ledge at the top.  Be careful lowering, you'll be at the end of the rope at the bottom.

content.description: Start at the left side of a small bulge. Getting above the bulge and onto the face is the crux. Pull up and throw right into a hand-sized pocket, then have fun moving up the wall on progressively larger holds.
content.location: 2nd route to the right of the Revolution is Evolution flake.

content.description: Pretty multi-colored face.  Technical.  High 1st bolt and a little sporty to the anchor.
content.location: 1st route to the right of "Spooky Tooth Right".

content.description: Gorgeous grey and black streak.  Pockets and some face holds.  Good climbing.
content.location: Right of "Save a Prayer...", in front of a dead and burned tree.

content.description: Continuous small holds to the fourth bolt where the route transitions to steeper jug pulling to the anchor. Lots of holds to choose from but not many good ones.  The climb is foot intensive and technical. Enjoy!
content.location: Start a few feet to the right of the Great Deceiver and the route gradually climbs to the right.

content.description: Do a boulder problem off the ground pulling from crimps to monos. One hard move. Finish with easier moves on better holds.  Climb on nice red water streaked rock.
content.location: Right of the black streak with Weasels Ripped My Flesh and 20 feet left of Manifest Destiny.
